key_points: The 2021 Genesis GV80 SUV was named a Top Safety Pick+ by the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety (IIHS).
This model is the same one Tiger Woods was driving during his February crash in the Los Angeles area.
At the time of Woods' crash, the GV80 had not yet undergone independent safety assessments.
The Genesis GV80 scored high marks on the IIHS's assessments of crashworthiness and crash prevention capability.
IIHS spokesman Russ Rader and Genesis Motor North America's chief safety officer Brian Latouf confirmed the vehicle's top safety performance.
The vehicle includes advanced safety features such as 10 standard airbags and forward-collision alert avoidance.
Over 36,000 people were killed in car crashes in the U.S. in 2019, highlighting the importance of vehicle safety.
Some speculate that the GV80's safety features may have contributed to saving Tiger Woods' life.
The GV80 was not initially included in IIHS's Top Safety Pick+ awards due to its newness.
Genesis emphasizes safety in its brand and engineering, with the GV80 starting at nearly $50,000.
spokespersons: Brian Latouf (Chief Safety Officer, Genesis Motor North America)
